text: Ricky Clint Gabriel (born 24 June 1991) is an English footballer who plays as a full-back. In September 2019, Gabriel received a 14 year prison sentence for firearms offences. ==Career== Gabriel began his senior career in 2012 at Antigua Barracuda in the USL Pro when he started an away game at Pittsburgh Riverhounds on 28 July. He made four appearances before being released at the end of the season. Gabriel then joined Dover Athletic, but only made appearances in the Kent Senior Cup and joined Spartan South Midlands Football League side Brimsdown for 2014-15. After three goals in eleven games, Gabriel joined Enfield Town in January 2015.Second Brimsdown star makes Enfield Town switchRicky Gabriel - Enfield Town After two-and-a-half seasons, Gabriel joined Braintree Town in summer 2017, and was part of the team that won the National League South playoffs in his first season. The brothers have played together at Brimsdown and Enfield Town.Ricky Gabriel signs for Enfield On 6 September 2019, at Blackfriars Crown Court, Gabriel was found guilty of conspiracy to possess firearms and ammunition with intent to endanger life in July and jailed for 14 years, alongside his brothers Ralston and Reiss. ==References== ==External links== * * Ricky Gabriel at Football Database * Ricky Gabriel at Aylesbury United Category:1991 births Category:Living people Category:Triplets Category:English footballers Category:Footballers from Bradford Category:Association football defenders Category:Antigua Barracuda F.C. players Category:Dover Athletic F.C. players Category:Brimsdown F.C. players Category:Enfield Town F.C. players Category:Braintree Town F.C. players Category:Maidenhead United F.C. players Category:USL Championship players Category:National League (English football) players Category:Isthmian League players Category:English expatriate footballers Category:Expatriate footballers in Antigua and Barbuda
